TITLE.P: Open tender competition for entry into a framework agreement for the purchase of consultancy services related to editorial internet sites for the Norwegian Government Agency for Financial Management.

SHORT_DESCR.P: The Norwegian Government Agency for Financial Management (DFØ) is carrying out an open tender competition for entry into a framework agreement with a service provider who shall cover our need for the purchase of consultancy services for the maintenance, development and consultancy services connected to our editorial internet sites (primarily dfo.no and our intranet), in addition to contributing to design and development of front end layers to other relevant services and systems for DFØ.

The primary focus of the agreement shall be to contribute to technical maintenance and development, but we wish also to have the possibility to be able to order assistance to the further development of design of the internet sites, editorial consulting and user testing.
The duration of the agreement will be up to 4 years.

The Norwegian Government Agency for Financial Management (DFØ) is carrying out an open tender competition for entry into a framework agreement with a service provider who shall cover our need for the purchase of consultancy services for the maintenance, development and consultancy services connected to our editorial internet sites (primarily dfo.no and our intranet), in addition to contributing to design and development of front end layers to other relevant services and systems for DFØ.

The primary focus of the agreement shall be to contribute to technical maintenance and development, but we wish also to have the possibility to be able to order assistance to the further development of design of the internet sites, editorial consulting and user testing.
The duration of the agreement will be up to 4 years.

SUITABILITY.P: Valid tax certificates must be enclosed with the tender. DFØ will assess any tax arrears.

A tax certificate and a VAT certificate shall be presented as confirmation that due taxes and duties have been paid. The certificates shall be issued by the tax collector at the tenderer's place of business and by the tax office in the relevant company's home county. Tenderers with a business address outside of Norway must submit certificates confirming that the tenderer has its taxes and fees in order in their home country. The certificates should not be older than 6 months from the tender deadline.
Tenderers are required to have a legally established company.
Tenderers shall enclose a description of the tenderer's organisation, company structure, ownership structure and business area. A company registration certificate must be attached.

Tenderers shall ensure that the employees in their company and others who contribute to fulfilment of the contract do not have worse wages and work conditions than those in tariff agreements, regulations or what is otherwise seen as normal for the relevant profession. This only applies to employees who are directly involved in fulfilling the contract. The management of the company is responsible for complying with this regulation.

Tenderers shall document, via a self-declaration, that the wages and work terms for those who contribute to the fulfilment of the contract, are not contrary to the tariff agreements, regulations or what is otherwise seen as normal for the relevant profession.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_INFO.P: Satisfactory finances are required to carry out the assignment. A credit appraisal is therefore required, which shall include a credit rating, part judgement and historical rating. The credit rating shall be carried out by a publicly certified credit institution.

The credit rating must not be lower than Score A (creditworthy) or equivalent if a different form of score is used (assessment of figures). Tenderers with a rating lower than A or equivalent (i.e. not credit worthy or credit worthy with security) will not be considered.

Tenderers shall enclose a credit rating from a certified credit rating agency. The credit rating shall be based on the last known fiscal figures (Annual Financial Statements 2017/2016). The credit report shall not be older than 6 months from the tender deadline.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_MIN_LEVEL.P: The credit rating must not be lower than score A (creditworthy) or equivalent if a different form of score is used (assessment of figures). Tenderers with a rating lower than A or equivalent (i.e. not credit worthy or credit worthy with security) will not be considered.
